page.title: 20A LOCAL CUSTOM continued
page.content: In the Allendale{FIRE SERVICE}there are twelve firemen and one fire engine. There are four fire stations in the Allendale District. The fire engines carry 1000 gallons of water in a tank. On the outside of the fire engine there is a{ladder}that will go up to ten metres per stage, and it has four stages, 1 hose and 3 water carriers and breathing aparatus. The fireman's equipment consists of {wellington}boots,special plastic over pants,gas mask,a timer,air back-pack and a special helmet.The firemen often go to Kielder Forest where there are many fires.Six firemen are required to man the engine and since they are part time the first six men to turn out are chosen.The men are called out by means of a bleeper which they carry constantly. This is operated by Head Office at Morpeth.
